medical_history.chief_complaint: Management of fetal growth restriction (FGR) and oligohydramnios at 33 weeks and 6 days of gestation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms related to fetal growth restriction and oligohydramnios were identified during regular monitoring and ultrasound; the first ultrasound at 12 weeks gestation indicated normal crown-rump length. The condition was progressively monitored every three days, with ultrasound findings confirming reduced amniotic fluid and low estimated fetal weight.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Iatrogenic hypothyroidism, treated with Levotiroxine 75 mcg, due to hemithyroidectomy for a benign thyroid nodule in 2016.
medical_history.social_history: Patient reported smoking five cigarettes per day, consuming four glasses of wine per day during the pregnancy, and using cocaine during the first two months of pregnancy.
